p: All the tested EOs showed a clear larvicidal activity against Ae. albopictus. The median lethal concentration (LC 50) of EOs, calculated by probit regression showed that R. chalepensis EO resulted the most toxic one with LC 50 = 93.60 μL L −1 while, A. verlotiorum and L. dentata EOs LC 50 values were 324.00 and 602.80 μL L −1, respectively (Table 3). The relative median potency (RMP) analysis of probits showed that R. chalepensis EO was significantly more effective than A. verlotiorum and L. dentata EOs ( R. chalepensis vs A. verlotiorum, RMP: 0.232, CI: 0.032–0.597; R. chalepensis vs L. dentata, RMP: 0.194, CI: 0.025–0.497), while the difference between A. verlotiorum and L. dentata EOs was not significant ( A. verlotiorum vs L. dentata, RMP: 0.839, CI: 0.401–1.613).
